There's a SpaceX hanger at 39A? Wasn't 39A for the Saturn V? None of SpaceX's rockets could fill those shoes.
39A was originally Saturn V, than shuttle, and a few years ago NASA gave it to SpaceX for 20 years
spacex bought it for 20 years

I know, honestly there no way NASA gets to Mars with one pad, either they'll take it back or build a new one

> 
> I know, honestly there no way NASA gets to Mars with one pad, either they'll take it back or build a new one

NASA got to the Moon with one pad (if you leave out Apollo 10) ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

But I digress... Glad to hear ya got it working. KK is definitely a dependency. RSS, only if you want to use my old cfg's (which will probably float a bit above the ground now anyway, since the terrain dropped a couple meters in 1.0) But nothing's stopping you from loading up stock, hitting Ctrl+K and spawning them around the KSC or wherever ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Edit:

When KSC's weather gets bad, we'll need [somewhere else](http://i.imgur.com/C9Nyi6Q.png) to land the shuttle, right? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-16T00:20:24Z" title="08/16/2015 12:20  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 16, 2015</time> by Tristonwilson12**
If that was the question

Nasa in itself has KSC, which is VAB, 39A, B, and C as well as shuttle infrastructure. Every other pad is on the cape, which is owned by the Air Force. SpaceX has 39A, so the only pad that nasa has, (other than the literal slab of concrete that us 39C) is 39B, which is for SLS. Some space politics for ya

![PbgvPQz.png](http://i.imgur.com/PbgvPQz.png)

![VV6H3dU.png](http://i.imgur.com/VV6H3dU.png)

Unfortunately I don't see this working in RSS. The modder behind Kerbal Konstructs, has stated that he doesn't plan on RSS compatibility. Shame.

Okay, I have this stuff working in stock now.

I have set the rescalefactor to 0.64 to make it more stock-compatible. It's not anywhere near the stock KSC.

Pics coming soon!

Nice! It's looking good Kartoffelkuchen! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Say what now? A bunch of us already have statics placed within RSS using Kerbal Konstructs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yes, quite. I've never stated that Kerbal Konstructs doesn't support RSS. To clarify, I won't support issues with RSS and I won't be attempting to make KK automatically adjust statics placed in stock.

From the **KerbinSide** FAQ:

> 
> Q - Any support of rescaled Kerbin/Kerbol systems like RSS?
> A - No, sorry. That'd need a complete re-work of Kerbal Konstructs and/or a lot of manual replacement of objects.

With KerbinSide's updated licence, there's nothing to stop someone using KerbinSide assets in RSS and then releasing a config pack.
